dataset.title: LAGOS_NE_NHDReachCrossReference

individualName.surName: Patricia Soranno, Michigan State University, Principal Investigator
Kendra Cheruvelil, Michigan State University, Co-Principal Investigator

abstract.para:
LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE NHDReachCrossReference table is a subset of the NHDReachCrossReference table that is created from the same downloaded data as was used to create layers containing reach codes. It is filtered to only reach codes that are found in LAGOS_NE_AllLakes_1ha (and any other LAGOS-NE "lake" layer).
Note: Complete metadata is available within the download file. This metadata can be viewed with esri ArcGIS software or by viewing the imbedded .xml file. Coverages and grids contain a file called metadata.xml and shapefiles contain a file called (shapefile_name.xml). These files can be exported to FGDC and ISO metadata formats.

section.title: Use Constraints
section.para: The LAGOS-NE database should be acknowledged in products derived from these data. The citation may include the DOI of the database and/or the accompanying manuscript.

section.title: Data Credit
section.para: METHODS PUBLICATION: Soranno, Patricia A., Edward G. Bissell, Kendra S. Cheruvelil, Samuel T. Christel, Sarah M. Collins, C. Emi Fergus, Christopher T. Filstrup et al. "Building a multi-scaled geospatial temporal ecology database from disparate data sources: fostering open science and data reuse." GigaScience 4, no. 1 (2015): 28. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: Support for creating LAGOS-NE was provided by the National Science Foundation MacroSystems Biology Program in the Emerging Frontiers Division of the Biological Sciences Directorate (EF-1065786and EF-1638679 to MSU, EF-1065649 to ISU, and EF-1065818 and EF-1638554 to UW) and the USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture, Hatch project 176820 to PAS. Author KEW thanks the STRIVE Programme (2011-W-FS-7) from the Environmental Protection Agency, Ireland. Author SMC also thanks the NSF Division of Biological Infrastructure (1401954). Further credits for other modules LAGOS-NE beyond the GIS Database are detailed in Soranno et al. 2017.

purpose.para: We have created a database for lakes in the northeastern-most 17 U.S. states called LAGOS-NE (LAke multi-scaled GeOSpatial and temporal database). We had three related motivations for developing this database: (1) to develop the basic understanding of lake nutrients and productivity at sub-continental scales, with a focus on studying cross-scale interactions and their drivers using water quality data on thousands of lakes collected overacross the last several decades (see Soranno et al. 2014 and Soranno et al. 2015 for details); (2) to build the capacity to apply this scientific understanding to environmental management and policy of freshwaters; and, (3) to foster broad-scale research by designing an open-science database infrastructure that includes detailed characterization of lake ecological context that is extensible for future uses and by making the data and methods publicly accessible. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database is provided for the purposes of displaying LAGOS-NE data, understanding their geospatial relationships, and supporting further spatial analyses with these data. The LAGOS-NE NHDReachCrossReference table contains information tracking changes over time to reach codes. This table can help resolve relationships between the water body identifiers used in LAGOS-NE and those that appear in other datasets based on or connected to NHD features.

publisher.organizationName: Patricia Soranno, Michigan State University, Principal Investigator
